member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents
member.summary: Specifies the DashboardLayout events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.Parent
member.summary: DashboardLayout component reference.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.Changed
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the panel's position are changed.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: You can capture this event to detect the panel position changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.Created
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the DashboardLayout is created.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: You can update panel data or perform required action when the component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.Destroyed
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the DashboardLayout is destroyed.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Required actions can be performed once the component is destroyed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.PanelDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a panel is dragged continuously.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify the panel drag action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnDragStart
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a panel is about to drag.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the panel drag action is started.Panel drag can be prevented in required cases through this event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnDragStop
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a dragged panel is dropped.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the panel drag action is stopped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.Resizing
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a panel is being resized continuously.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the panel is being resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnResizeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a panel is started to resize.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the panel resize action is started.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnResizeStop
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a panel resize ends.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the panel resize action is stopped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnWindowResize
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when re-sizing the window.
member.value: An event callback function.
member.remarks: Helps to identify that the window resize action takes place. Panels can be refreshed during window resize through this event callback.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutEvents.OnInitialized
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout
member.summary: The DashboardLayout is a grid structured layout component, that helps to create a dashboard with panels. Panels hold the UI components or data to be visualized with flexible options like resize, reorder, drag-n-drop, remove and add, that allows users to easily place the panels at a desired position within the grid layout.
Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
Specifies the DashboardLayout component.

member.summary: protected variable declared.

member.summary: Update panel position and content height after collision calculation.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.GetIdValues(Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.DashboardLayoutPanel)
member.summary: Update the id values for panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the id attribute for the DashboardLayout element.
member.value: Accepts the string value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the DashboardLayout permits the reordering of panels through dragging.
member.value: true, if the drag option can be enabled. Otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowFloating
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the DashboardLayout panels must fill the available cells while dragging or resizing.
member.value: true, if the floating option can be enabled. Otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If is set to true, then the DashboardLayout will automatically move the panels upwards to fill the empty available cells while dragging or resizing the panels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the panels in DashboardLayout can be resized.
member.value: true, if the resizing option can be enabled. Otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.CellAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the cell aspect ratio of the panel.
member.value: A double value that representing the cell aspect ratio of panel in component. The default value is 1.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5" CellAspectRatio="2"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.CellSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between the panels.
member.value: An array of double values that defines the spacing between panels of component. The default value is {5, 5}.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5" CellSpacing="@(new double[]{20 ,20 })"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the number of columns to be created in the DashboardLayout.
member.value: Accepts an integer value that representing the number of columns in component. The default value is 1.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.DraggableHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the draggable handle selector which will act as dragging handler for the panels. You can enable dragging for a particular element of panel using this property.
member.value: Accepts the string value.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5" DraggableHandle=".e-panel-header"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to persist the component's state between page reloads.
member.value: true, if the persistence can be enabled. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for the DashboardLayout component.
member.value: true, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.MediaQuery
member.summary: Gets or sets the media query value where the DashboardLayout becomes stacked layout when the resolution meets.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is `max-width:600px`.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5" MediaQuery=" max-width:800px"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.DashboardHtmlAttributes
member.summary: Used to specify additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.SfDashboardPanels
member.summary: Defines the panels property of the DashboardLayout component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ResizableHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets the resizing handles directions used for resizing the panels.
member.value: Resize directions of the DashboardLayout panels. The default resize direction is 'south-east'.

example.code: <SfDashboardLayout Columns="5" AllowResizing="true" ResizableHandles="ResizableHandle.NorthEast"> <DashboardLayoutPanels> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="one" Column="0" Row="0"> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 1</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> <DashboardLayoutPanel Id="two" Row="1" Column="0" SizeX=1 SizeY=2> <HeaderTemplate>Panel 2</HeaderTemplate> </DashboardLayoutPanel> </DashboardLayoutPanels> </SfDashboardLayout>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.ShowGridLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of grid lines for panels within the DashboardLayout.
member.value: true, if the grid lines should be shown. Otherwise, false.

member.summary: Removes a panel from the DashboardLayout.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterEvents
member.summary: Configure the event handlers to handle the events with Splitter component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterEvents.Parent
member.summary: The splitter is a layout user interface (UI) component that splits the layout into multiple panes with resizable and collapsible support.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterEvents.OnCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked on the pane collapse action.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane
 @code{ private void OnCollapseHandler(BeforeExpandEventArgs args) { if (someCondition) { args.Cancel = true; // Cancel the collapse operation if needed } else { // Perform additional logic } } }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterEvents.OnExpand

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane
member.summary: Configure each pane and its properties to handle the pane behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the splitter pane element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for the content within the component.
member.value: A that represents the custom content template.
member.remarks: The content template is a customizable area within the Splitter where you can define custom content. By providing a RenderFragment, you can create complex layouts or embed other components within the Splitter's panes.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Collapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pane is initially collapsed within the component.
member.value: true if the pane is initially collapsed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When a pane is collapsed, its content is hidden, and only a minimal representation of the pane remains visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.CollapsedChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Collapsible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pane is collapsible in the component.
member.value: true if the pane is collapsible; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When a pane is collapsible, users can interact with a control, typically a button or an icon, to collapse or expand the pane.
By setting this property to true, you enable collapsible behavior for the pane. When set to false, the pane cannot be collapsed or expanded manually.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the within the component.
member.value: A string representing the content to be displayed within the pane.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the component.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Use this property to apply custom styling to the component. You can define your own CSS classes and use them here to control the visual appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the within the component.
member.value: A string representing the maximum size of the pane. This can be specified using CSS units such as pixels (px), percentages (%).
member.remarks: The maxsize property defines the maximum allowable size for the pane. This limits the expansion of the pane beyond the specified maximum size.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.MaxChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of the within the component.
member.value: A string representing the minimum size of the pane. This can be specified using CSS units such as pixels (px), percentages (%).
member.remarks: The minSize property defines the minimum allowable size for the pane. This prevents the pane from being resized to a size smaller than the specified minimum size.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.MinChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Resizable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pane is resizable within the component.
member.value: true if the pane is resizable; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When a pane is resizable, users can interact with its edges to adjust its size. This allows them to customize the layout by making panes larger or smaller as needed.
By default, the pane is resizable. Setting this property to false will prevent users from resizing the pane.
You can combine this property with the and properties to define the resizing behavior more precisely.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the within the component.
member.value: A string representing the size of the pane. This can be specified using CSS units such as pixels (px), percentages (%).
member.remarks: The size property defines the initial size of the pane. The value determines the width or height of the pane, depending on the of the Splitter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.SizeChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SplitterPane.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pane is visible within the component.
member.value: true if the pane is visible; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to `false`, the pane element will not be shown in the DOM. This property can be used to provide conditional pane rendering in Splitter.

member.summary: The splitter is a layout user interface (UI) component that splits the layout into multiple panes with resizable and collapsible support.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Method invoked when the component has received parameters from its parent.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.
member.param: Set to true if this is the first time OnAfterRender(Boolean) has been invoked.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for component.
member.value: Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: You can specify only unique value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets the content for panes of the Splitter.
member.value: Accepts a RenderFragment that defines the content of the UI element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the component.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Use this property to apply custom styling to the component. You can define your own CSS classes and use them here to control the visual appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnableReversePanes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the order of splitter panes should be reversed.
member.value: true, if the splitter panes are reordered. Otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When set to true, the order of the panes within the component will be reversed. This means that the right-most or bottom-most pane will appear as the first pane, and the other panes will follow in reverse order.
Reversing the pane order can be useful in scenarios where you want to present content in the opposite direction, such as creating layouts that flow from right to left or from bottom to top.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnableRtl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether right-to-left (RTL) mode is enabled for the component.
member.value: true if RTL mode is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When RTL mode is enabled, the content of the component will be presented in a right-to-left direction. This affects the positioning and alignment of the splitter panes and other content.
Enabling RTL mode can be useful when designing applications for languages that are written from right to left, such as Arabic, Hebrew, or Persian.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component is enabled.
member.value: true if the component is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When the component is enabled, user interactions and behaviors associated with the Splitter, such as resizing panes, are allowed. When disabled, these interactions are restricted and the component becomes non-interactive.
By default, the component is enabled. You can set this property to false to prevent user interactions temporarily, if needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether persistence of the component's state is enabled.
member.value: true if persistence is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When persistence is enabled, the state of the component is saved and restored across page reloads or navigations. This allows the component to remember its previous state and provide a consistent user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the component.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is 100%.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the component.
member.value: An enum value representing the orientation of the Splitter. Possible values are and .
member.remarks:
The orientation determines whether the Splitter will arrange its panes horizontally or vertically.
- : Panes are arranged side by side horizontally. - : Panes are arranged one above the other vertically.
Choose the appropriate orientation based on your desired layout and design.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.SeparatorSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the separators between panes in the component.
member.value: The size of the separators, specified as a double value.
member.remarks:
The separator size determines the width of the space between adjacent panes within the Splitter component.
Example: - Setting SeparatorSize to 10 will create a 10-pixel wide separator between adjacent panes.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfSplitter.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the component.
member.value: Accepts the string value. The default value is 100%.
member.remarks: The value can be either in pixel or percentage format.

example.code:
Left Pane
Right Pane

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel
member.summary: Interface for a class PaneProperties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Collapsed
member.summary: Specifies whether a pane is collapsed on the initial rendering of the splitter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Collapsible
member.summary: Specifies whether a pane is capable to collapse.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Content
member.summary: Specifies the content of the split pane.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be appended on the corresponding pane of the Splitter. It is used to customize the Splitter component panes. One or more custom CSS classes can be specified to the Splitter panes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized more than the specified maximum limit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized less than the specified minimum size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Resizable
member.summary: Specifies the value whether a pane is resizable or not. By default, the Splitter panes are resizable. You can disable resize functionality for any specific panes using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.PanePropertiesModel.Size
member.summary: Configures the properties for each pane. For horizontal splitter, the size act as width. For vertical splitter, the size act as height.

member.summary: Specifies PaneSettings value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.Internal.PaneSetting.Collapsed
member.summary: Specifies whether a pane is collapsed on the initial rendering of the splitter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.Internal.PaneSetting.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized more than the specified maximum limit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.Internal.PaneSetting.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum size of a pane. The pane cannot be resized less than the specified minimum size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.Internal.PaneSetting.Size
member.summary: Configures the properties for each pane. For horizontal splitter, the size act as width. For vertical splitter, the size act as height.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline
member.summary: The Blazor Timeline component presents a series of events or activities in chronological order, allowing users to track the progression of time.
member.remarks: Timeline items can be populated by specifying within tag directive.
member.example:
In the below code example, a basic Timeline component is initialized with tag directive.
<SfTimeline> <TimelineItems> <TimelineItem></TimelineItem> <TimelineItem></TimelineItem> <TimelineItem></TimelineItem> <TimelineItem></TimelineItem> </TimelineItems> </SfTimeline>

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.UpdateChildProperty(Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem)
member.summary: Updates the Timeline with list of items from the TimelineItem tag directive when they are rendered.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.UpdateItems(System.Collections.Generic.List{Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem})
member.summary: Updates the Items list with the list provided from the TimelineItems tag directive.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the item content in relation to the component.
member.value: A value indicates the alignment of timeline items. The default value is .
member.remarks: Use this property to control the display of item content appear before or after each item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.ID
member.summary: Sets id attribute for the timeline element.
member.value: Accepts the string value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom CSS class to customize the component.
member.value: A string representing the CSS class to be applied. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: You can use this property to apply custom styles to the component by specifying a CSS class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the component.
member.remarks: The enumeration defines the possible orientations for the component. You can set this property to control whether the timeline is displayed horizontally or vertically.
member.value: A value representing the orientation of the . The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Reverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the items are rendered in reverse order.
member.value: true if the items are rendered in reverse order; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Template
member.summary: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each item in the component.
member.value: The template content. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The allows you to define a custom template for rendering each step. Use the templateâ€™s context parameter to access and properties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of items in timeline.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Timeline including HTML element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.Created
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the rendering is completed.
member.value: An event call back function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfTimeline.ItemRendered
member.summary: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when a timeline item in the component is rendered.
member.value: An event callback function that is triggered when a item is rendered within the Timeline.
member.remarks: Subscribe to this event to perform additional actions or apply custom styling after a item has been rendered. It provides an opportunity to dynamically modify the appearance or behavior of individual items during the rendering process.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the position of timeline items in relation to the component.

item.description: Displays item content to the top and opposite content to the bottom when the Timeline is in a horizontal orientation, or the content to the left and opposite content to the right when the Timeline is in a vertical orientation.

Displays item content to the bottom and opposite content to the top when the Timeline is in a horizontal orientation, or the content to the right and opposite content to the left when the Timeline is in a vertical orientation.
Displays item content alternatively, regardless of the Timeline's orientation.
Displays item content in alternate reverse, regardless of the Timeline's orientation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineAlignment.Before
member.summary: Displays item content to the top and opposite content to the bottom when the Timeline is in a horizontal orientation, or the item content to the left and opposite content to the right when the Timeline is in a vertical orientation.
member.value: Specifies the position to display items content on the top in a horizontal orientation, or on the left in a vertical orientation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineAlignment.After
member.summary: Displays item content to the bottom and opposite content to the top when the Timeline is in a horizontal orientation, or the content to the right and opposite content to the left when the Timeline is in a vertical orientation.
member.value: Specifies the position to display items content on the bottom in a horizontal orientation, or on the right in a vertical orientation.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineAlignment.Alternate
member.summary: Displays item content alternatively, regardless of the Timeline's orientation.
member.value: Specifies the item content to be displayed alternatively.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineAlignment.AlternateReverse
member.summary: Displays item content in alternate reverse, regardless of the Timeline's orientation.
member.value: Specifies the item content to be in reverse alternative.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineOrientation
member.summary: Represents the orientation options for the component.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineOrientation.Horizontal
member.summary: Represents a horizontal orientation for the component.
member.value: Specifies the orientation indicating that the timeline items are arranged horizontally.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineOrientation.Vertical
member.summary: Represents a vertical orientation for the component.
member.value: Specifies the orientation indicating that the timeline items are arranged vertically.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineRenderedEventArgs
member.summary: Represents event arguments for Timeline rendered event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineRenderedEventArgs.Index
member.summary: Gets the item data associated with the rendered timeline item.
member.value: An to the current item element that is being rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineRenderedEventArgs.Item
member.summary: Gets the index of the rendered current item.
member.value: It represents the index of the rendered item.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItemContext
member.summary: Represents the context of , and which is used to render the content of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItemContext.Item
member.summary: Gets the item data associated with the rendered timeline item.
member.value: An to the current item element that is being rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItemContext.ItemIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of the rendered current item.
member.value: It represents the index of the rendered item.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem
member.summary: A class that represents items of component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.Parent
member.summary: Indicates the TimelineItems component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.BaseParent
member.summary: Indicates the SfTimeline component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.DotCss
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS class for the icon associated with the .
member.value: A string representing the CSS class for the icon. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: The icon CSS class is used to style the icon displayed for the timeline item. If specified, it determines the visual representation of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom content template for rendering individual items in the component.
member.value: The template content. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The allows you to define a custom content template for rendering each item. Use the contentâ€™s context parameter to access and properties.

example.code: <SfTimeline> <TimelineItems> <TimelineItem> <Content>Ordered</Content> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Processing</Content> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Shipped</Content> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Delivered</Content> </TimelineItem> </TimelineItems> </SfTimeline>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.OppositeContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom opposite text content template for rendering individual items in the component.
member.value: The template content. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The allows you to define a custom opposite text content template for rendering each item. Use the oppositeContentâ€™s context parameter to access and properties.

example.code: <SfTimeline> <TimelineItems> <TimelineItem> <Content>Ordered</Content> <OppositeContent>10:30 am</OppositeContent> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Processing</Content> <OppositeContent>11:30 am</OppositeContent> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Shipped</Content> <OppositeContent>12:30 am</OppositeContent> </TimelineItem> <TimelineItem> <Content>Delivered</Content> <OppositeContent>01:30 am</OppositeContent> </TimelineItem> </TimelineItems> </SfTimeline>

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom CSS class for customize the appearance of timeline item.
member.value: A string representing the CSS class to be applied to the item. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: You can use this property to apply custom styles to individual items within the Timeline component by specifying a CSS class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.TimelineItem.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the timeline item is disabled.
member.value: true if the item is disabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
